```{r}
# Load R library ---------------------------------------------------------------
library(ggplot2)
```

### Frequency table for variable: `r x`

```{r}
#| output: asis

# Generate child document ------------------------------------------------------
# We would like to generate a:
# 1. section title which states the dataset used
# 2. a ggplot   

# To do this, we can make use of a child document that gets knitted separately
# and embedded into the parent document. 

# Output table -----------------------------------------------------------------
iris |>
    dplyr::count(!!rlang::ensym(x)) |>
    knitr::kable()
```
